729539f-a.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Manor Road
729539f-a.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, between Manor Road
and Forest Hill Road, showing Seaview Hospital, the
New York City Farm Colony. Seaview Hospital is one
of the largest tuberculosis hospitals in the world.
The farm colony is used as an asylum for the aged.
Anril 25, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729539f-a.folder: Rockland Avenue & Manor Road, Staten Island, NY

729124f-a.title: Richmond: Manor Road - Rockland Avenue
729124f-a.text:
Manor Road, west side, 5OO yards north of Rockland Avenue and
225 feet back of the road. Tnis house belonged to Dr. O. Rotton,
according to Beers's maps of 1874 and 1887. In 1898 it was the
Edward Hibberd home, and in 1907 the Fanny J. Byne's house (Robinson
waps). In the far background, on the orest of the hill, are buildings
of Sea View gospital. Mr. Sperr states that the house was built be-
between 1850 and 156O.
1924
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729124f-a.folder: Manor Road & Rockland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729538f-a.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Manor Road
729538f-a.text:
Rockland Ave., north side, 400 yards west of Manor Road, showing
the Grote House. It is over one hundred years old and was orignally the
home of Colonel Richard Connor, where Aaron Burr made his last call.
It was later oooupied by Dr. Rotton. The house no longer appears on the
1917 map by Broaley.
April 19, 1911.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
729538f-a.folder: Rockland Avenue & Manor Road, Staten Island, NY

729123f-a.title: Richmond: Manor Road - Rockland Avenue
729123f-a.text:
(1)
Manor Road, west side, about 500 yards north of Rockland
Avenue, showing the old Frech house, in the valley about 450
feet back of the road. P. L. Sperr states that the spring, in
the foreground, is the largest on Staten Island.
February 12, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
A distant view of the Frech house as seen from Manor Road. Iu
the background, on the hilltop, are buildings of Sea view Hospital.
May 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729123f-a.folder: Manor Road & Rockland Avenue, Staten Island, NY

Meisner Avenue, west from Rockland Avenue.
~bout 1910

729540f-a.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Manor Road
729540f-a.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, between Manor Road
and Forest Hill Road, showing one of the new buildings
of Sa View Hospital, built by the Works Progress
Adminstration.
February, 1937
W. P. A. Photo
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

729541f.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Manor Road
729541f.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, between Manor Road
and Forest Hill Avenue, showing W. P. A. workmen erecting
a new building for Sea View Hospital.
February, 1937
W. P. A. Photo
City wide Project
